meanings.definition: Mischievous or playful pranks or tricks.
meanings.sent1: The children played some didos on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent2: She giggled at their didos during recess.
meanings.sent3: The didos they pulled off were harmless and fun.
meanings.sent4: Their didos at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The didos involved silly costumes and props.

meanings.definition: A fit of temper or tantrum.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he threw a didos in frustration.
meanings.sent2: The toddler had a didos when he couldn't get his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: Her didos over the broken toy was quickly forgotten.
meanings.sent4: The didos he threw was loud but short-lived.
meanings.sent5: The didos ended with a hug and an apology.

meanings.definition: A mischievous or playful act or caper.
meanings.sent1: Their didos in the park involved hiding and surprising each other.
meanings.sent2: The cat's didos with the yarn left a mess in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The didos of the puppies chasing their tails was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The didos of the squirrels stealing nuts entertained the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The didos of the clowns made the audience burst into laughter.
